meanings.sent1: The family heirloom was a prized possession.
meanings.sent2: She wore her prized necklace on special occasions.
meanings.sent3: The prized trophy gleamed under the bright lights.
meanings.sent4: Her prized collection of stamps was the envy of her friends.
meanings.sent5: The prized painting hung prominently in the art gallery.

meanings.definition: To regard or treat as precious
meanings.sent1: He prized the old watch that belonged to his grandfather.
meanings.sent2: She prized her friendship with him above all else.
meanings.sent3: The cat prized the shiny toy as if it were a treasure.
meanings.sent4: The teacher prized honesty in her students above all other qualities.
meanings.sent5: The gardener prized the rare flower and took great care of it.

meanings.definition: To take great pleasure or pride in
meanings.sent1: She prized her ability to play the piano beautifully.
meanings.sent2: He prized the opportunity to represent his country in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The chef prized his secret recipe for the delicious dessert.
meanings.sent4: The athlete prized the gold medal he won at the championship.
meanings.sent5: The author prized the positive feedback from readers on her book.
